for the splitting of water.The recombination of excitons may be drastically increased on the large aggregated Pt particles in Pt(Imp) TiNT, due to the significant Pt-Pt interaction 20 as well as the non-uniform distributions 20 of the Pt clusters, resulting in extremely low photo catalytic activities and photocurrent densities.Sodium ions may also act as recombination sites in Pt(Imp)TiNT, as reported by Fernandez et al. 21.

is a photocatalytic process. The oxygen evolution rate with Pt(IE)TiNT was almost stoichiometric with the mole ratio of H 2 O 2 2. Bare TiO 2 (P-25) and TiNT showed no activities for O 2 evolution in either pure water or aqueous methanol solution under visible light (Fig. 6).Furthermore, just trace amount of O 2 was evolved with the Pt(Imp)TiNT and Pt(Imp)TiO 2 (P-25) in either aqueous methanol or pure water.However, it is noteworthy that the Pt ionized titania nanotube, Pt(IE)TiNT, release significant

We report a new material, platinum ion-exchanged titania nanotubes (Pt(IE)TiNT) synthesized by hydrothermal method, was found to be active under visible light irradiation.The platinum nanoparticles well embeded in nanotube matrixes in the ionized samples were highly photoactive materials for the stoichiometric production of hydrogen and oxygen by the splitting of water under visible light at one sun, resulting in hydrogen evolution rates of 14.6 and 2.3 lmolh in aqueous methanol and pure water,

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: out with 0.5 g of fine powder photocatalysts in an outer irradiation Pyrex cell (300 ml) reaction system under the visible light (k 400 nm) irradiation using an ozone free Xe arc lamp (300 W, Hamamatsu: L 2479) attached with UV cut filter (FSQ-GG400 minimum spectral range of transmittance k 1 (4 0 0) bought from Newport Corporation) at one sun (AM 1.5).The details of the photocatalytic water splitting procedures have been described in our previous work except the substitution of UV light source to visible

of UV light source to visible light and the type of reactor used 12. The prepared samples were characterized by high resolution transmission electron micorscopy (HR-TEM), Philips TECNAI-F20, at accelerated voltage 160 kV), X-ray diffraction pattern (XRD, Rigaku X-ray diffractometer, operating at 40 kV and 40 mA using Cu Ka radiations), UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectroscopy (UV-vis DRS, Shimadzu-UV525).Photocurrent density was measured by using a scanning potentiostate (EG G273), with the software (EG

a scanning potentiostate (EG G273), with the software (EG GM542), as reported elsewhere 17.The photocurrent densities were measured using the catalysts film as the working electrodes, the Pt wire as the counter electrode and an AgAgCl3 M NaCl reference electrode, in an electrochemical cell (10 ml), with pH 9, 0.1 M Na 2 SO 3 as the electrolyte, under visible light.As describe in the literature 17, photocurrent densities are proportional to the number of photo formed electrons.Bare TiNT shows very low

water.However, it is noteworthy that the Pt ionized titania nanotube, Pt(IE)TiNT, was significantly active for the production of hydrogen under visible light, at rates of 14.6 and 2.3 lmol H 2 h in the aqueous methanol solution and pure water, respectively.The catalyst was not deactivated with over 36 h of running.The production of hydrogen stopped in the dark as the light was turned off, but resumed when the visible light was turned on again, indicating the hydrogen production is a photocatalytic process.

TiNT shows very low photocurrent densities under one sun (100 mWcm 2 ).The photocurrent densities of Pt(IE)TiNT are much higher than those of Pt(Imp)TiNT, even though they contain similar amounts of platinum.The possibility of sulphate ion acts as scavenger and might hamper in the photocurrent generation can be deducted since the applied potential for the all the samples are the same (0.5 V), however in dark potential all samples response to almost zero.These results suggest that presence of platinum
